text:
Hello everyone! I hope you had a great summer so far. I found this to be interesting. For a long time it seemed the Dweb community and web3 to be at oods. But here we have Filecoin ( web3) founding spritely (dweb) .
I'm looking forward to see more collaboration along these lines in the future:  <https://twitter.com/dustyweb/status/1559960708007305217>

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/dustyweb|@dustyweb>: The <https://twitter.com/spritelyinst|@spritelyinst>, of which I'm CTO, has received its first multi-year substantial funding thanks to <https://twitter.com/FFDWeb|@FFDWeb>! <https://spritely.institute/news/ffdw-support-announcement.html>

We're here to build the decentralized networks of the future! Time for a thread! :thread: <https://twitter.com/spritelyinst/status/1559958201067442176>
attachments.text:
The <https://twitter.com/spritelyinst|@spritelyinst>, of which I'm CTO, has received its first multi-year substantial funding thanks to <https://twitter.com/FFDWeb|@FFDWeb>! <https://spritely.institute/news/ffdw-support-announcement.html>

We're here to build the decentralized networks of the future! Time for a thread! :thread: <https://twitter.com/spritelyinst/status/1559958201067442176>

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/spritelyinst|@spritelyinst>: We so grateful to receive a substantial grant from <https://twitter.com/FFDWeb|@FFDWeb>! They are supporting us in so many ways...

<https://medium.com/@FFDWeb/ffdw-supports-spritely-networked-communities-institute-to-develop-decentralized-social-media-36833f7273c9>

Also, <https://twitter.com/dustyweb|@dustyweb> & <https://twitter.com/frandallfarmer|@frandallfarmer>  will be at #DWebCamp, would be happy to meet with potential supporters, sponsors, or technical partners in person.

Also, <https://twitter.com/dustyweb|@dustyweb> & <https://twitter.com/frandallfarmer|@frandallfarmer>  will be at #DWebCamp, would be happy to meet with potential supporters, sponsors, or technical partners in person.

elements.text:
Hello everyone! I hope you had a great summer so far. I found this to be interesting. For a long time it seemed the Dweb community and web3 to be at oods. But here we have Filecoin ( web3) founding spritely (dweb) .
I'm looking forward to see more collaboration along these lines in the future:

text: Umm, define "DWeb" and "Web3" without reference to orthogonal business models.

elements.text: Umm, define "DWeb" and "Web3" without reference to orthogonal business models.

text: <https://spritely.institute/news/blast-off-spritely-institutes-tech-tour.html|https://spritely.institute/news/blast-off-spritely-institutes-tech-tour.html> goblins looks like a really interesting language

elements.text: goblins looks like a really interesting language

text:
Hi <@UE6EFEPTQ> ! I would say Dweb tries to build a better web by focusing on P2P and decentralization but largely through technology. Web3 goes a bit further it also wants to build a better web with  P2P and decentralization but also wants to pull in the one of the social/cultural technology of money.
While dwb tries to be "neutral" about money, web3 tries to define in a new way.
Now that said there are going on humongous projections spaces onto web3.  As with aevery other sufficently popular/large concept ( AI etc..) people project their hopes, dreams and fears into it.
I wrote a bit more about it here:
<https://github.com/life-itself/web3/discussions/190>
and here: <https://andreass.gitlab.io/privacy_transparency_ex.html>

I wrote a bit more about it here:

text:
There is so much context I think I share some more: one of occasions where one could see (still?) the gap between dweb and web3 was the DAT project <=> IPFS project relationship.
DAT build some great things but if you ask them what the difference to IPFS was or if they would consider collaborating it would get ugly(I can provide some more details if there is interest)
So basically DAT admitted that they had same or very much related goals as IPFS but because they disliked crypto they went for it alone …

text: IPFS isn't a cryptocurrency project AFAIK :thinking_face:

elements.text: IPFS isn't a cryptocurrency project AFAIK

text: It isn’t but for some (dat) people it’s too close (filecoin?) to crypto.
